content: Hi, is there a way (cmd) to run rust-analyzer on a crate/workspace manually? (without having to use vscode/rla plugins etc)

What would be the result of such a manual run? There's ra_cli crate inside rust-analyzer which does somethig similar to, for example, type check every expression. But it exists mainly to debug ra itsefl
was wondering if I could find some crashes by running ra on the ~5000 crates in my cargo cache
cargo run --package ra_cli -- analysis_stats ../dir should do the trick
I always test my commits on RA itself, rustc and usually Chalk
